A: Sappho’s poetry was originally meant to be read silently, like modern poems.
B: Sappho’s poems were like lyrics to songs, accompanied by a lyre, a harp-like instrument.

A: Sappho's poems were like Homer's: long epics about gods and heroes.
B: Sappho was one of the first poets to write about abstract feelings and personal emotions.

A: Most of Sapp3ho’s poetry has survived intact thanks to careful preservation.
B: Sappho’s poetry survives mostly in fragments because her works were lost or destroyed over time.

A: Sappho’s poetry was largely forgotten and had little impact on later literature.
B: Her poetry influenced Roman and later European lyric poets.

A: Sappho was openly recognized as a queer icon during her own lifetime.
B: The idea of Sappho as a queer icon emerged long after her death.
